Key Arguments: The legislation represents censorship and undermines democratic debate.
The government is displaying distrust towards the public's ability to discern truth.
The bill promotes an 'us and them' mentality, which is undemocratic.
Critical thinking should be encouraged among the public rather than government control over information.
No group, especially unelected bureaucrats, should be the sole arbiter of truth.
Notable Quotes: We are sick of censorship. We want all opinions in the sunlight, debated, discussed and decided.
The government should trust the Australian public with the responsibility to discern fact from fiction, not take that responsibility away.
No one is able to be the sole source of truth, most definitely not a group of unelected bureaucrats in Canberra.
